page.title: 18BOATING ASSOCIATION
page.content: The Ravenglass Boating Association was formed 5 yrs.ago to prevent the M.O.D. from cutting off boating access to the harbour completely.It now provides talks,courses and a way of learning about boats and the sea.The secretary is Mr.Alan Routledge of Havercroft, Seascale,Cumbria.There are 130 members and they meet in the Pennington Arms regularly.The anchorage is very sheltered but it only has a channel to sea for 2\ hrs. either side of high tide:when the tide comes in it comes in fast.In the'5 Peaks'race in the summer Ravenglass is the harbour used for access to Scafell Pike(highest mountain in England).Cruising and sailing are the most popular types of boating though some enthusiasts fish, sail-board, water-ski and speedboat.A comercial trawler also sails from Ravenglass.
